VRF5wBICotj1bYO16lWjMg.text: Stay away!!!!!! Could not understand what the foreign cashier was saying, made placing near impossible. Could not make a pizza to save their life...

4Hs11Dytyc-Kei_NzJ0dGg.text: Solid pizza with good fries and onion rings. They accommodated my requests for a special pizza nicely and delivery was on time. Delivery was a little pricey but otherwise a good place for pizza.

p6_SygXONzvBvkmWNBjt6A.text: Congratulatory pizza delivery for moving my friend in from California! Delivery was on time, took about 30 minutes on a Friday night so not bad. Good pizza for a decent price! I hope my friend keeps going back!

bIX-HDgOAgkhWpx0YHclZw.text: Delivered to our hotel late after a day of family stuff. Hit the spot pretty well. Only wish I'd ordered a bigger one.

VhB3S6ojx3KvLWZ5Fm8Xmw.text: Ordered delivery to our hotel room at Bakery Square knowing it's a risky move. Actually everything was great. Fast, arrived hot, and food was good.

AUiZ_89c7ftdCRZu59KXEw.text: Easily the most delicious pizza in the Shadyside area. Their delivery service is always on time, and most of the time it's early! I think there's only been one instance where I was waiting the full time that they had given for the delivery. They've got tons of topping options, and they are competitively priced compared to some of the other pizza joints in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Medium pepperoni, sausage, yellow pepper, and pineapple pizza.

_dCuea44jsCiwwDWfD6kLw.text: They have inaccurate hours posted. I tried to order at 11:30 pm when yelp says they close at 2am and they were already closed. When I told them they have inaccurate hours posted the guy on the phone said "oh that's ok...." And hung up on me. I will never be ordering from them again, which is a shame since they are so close to me. I immediately called Pizza Parma which gladly delivered to me. I recommend ordering from Pizza Parma since they have similar menu items, they post accurate hours, and they don't hang up on you! Seriously? Why answer the phone?

vu_SscR12MimKaHBZ2i4jQ.text: Great pizza!   I practically lived there when I lived in Shadyside. My favorite pizza is the Shadyside special. They also offer gyros, wings, salads, calzones, wedgies, hoagies, pastas, traditional, white and gourmet pizzas.   Pizza Perfectta is part of a chain of pizza shops that include Cafe Milano, Pizza Milano and Pizza Mineo's

xbVLqyU_82MvlTuaIWJMQw.text: I was a bit disappointed with the pizza I got. I ordered the Milano special pizza, which had pepperoni, bacon, sausage, bell peppers, mushrooms, olives, tomatoes, etc, and the popcorn chicken. The order itself arrived within thirty minutes which was great. Although the pizza tasted decent, the crust was not crispy at all, the slices were pretty floppy. They also skimped on the toppings a bit. I was hoping for a more loaded pizza. I'm not watching my weight--I can handle it. As far as the popcorn chicken goes, it was too salty, even with the honey Dijon dipping sauce. Probably not ordering from here again.

5c1rb-C1H7kQiwpP-hYOEA.text: This is the first pizza I had when my wife and I moved to Pittsburgh from San Francisco about 10 years ago.  When I had it I thought, this pizza is okay, but the sauce is really good.  Ever since, we've always ordered it with extra sauce and it's been great.  I would give their standard pizza 3 stars--but with extra sauce, as you should order it and they should start serving it--it's 5 star pizza as good as any in Pittsburgh.

rfEk5i6b-ONYzd_A7XJrSQ.text: calzone was good, ricotta was xlnt, also had buffalo fries, arrived soggy - perhaps they should bake/appeared to be deep-fried   delivery was right at what they told me when I ordered, they're always good with service   I've had various pizzas as well, I'd order from here again, not exceptional but always tasty, on-time and good service, I'd give 3.5 if I could

QbiPTYYYAYgVfcM_4ZlOdw.text: They have really really really good pizza and food.. But dont eat this if ur on a diet lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My clients food a yummy gyro with fries and cucumber sauce on the side
Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy grilled chicken salad too go

UOf_mRf4joCvT60Iiwsc9Q.text: Not bad. Ordered a ham and cheese pizza for delivery. Arrived lukewarm but tasted decent enough. Won't have a hankerin' for this place but would order from them again if need be.

-1tgJFxJDHVK6qQyD1gQUg.text: Perfect for a quick lunch.  I had a New York style cheese pizza that was amazing, even the crust was delicious. Easily one of the most simplistic, amazing pieces of pizza I've ever had. The Greco piece of pizza I had was also perfect. It was topped with spinach and feta cheese I believe.   I was so full after man-handling my second piece of pizza I had to stop eating. But my friend had a half finished piece of Greco just sitting there on the table waiting for me to finish it. It was as if the pizza told me to pick it up and keep nibbling and nibbling . This resulted in some sort of religious full feeling. God himself wanted me to finish that piece of pizza, and I listened.

a2QBFAUGinf24L2VApY4iw.text: After ordering from here again I bump my rating up a star.  I've ordered their breadsticks the past two times and have been impressed.  Simple breadstick with a bit of butter brushed on and sprinkled with Parmesan cheese has me swooning.  The marinara sauce to dip it in is amazing as well.

0ycIStdk4ubzNjKTUC9nqg.text: Excellent eggplant parmesan and pizza! I've ordered from here many times. Great delivery. Highly recommend!

0vLwL1mM429GXcf7pJ__1A.text: I've really enjoyed their pizza so far. I also ordered a chicken salad and it was tasty for a pizza take out place, nothing too fancy. I have only had the food at this place by delivery and it has always come before and hour has passed. The pizza always comes warm and ready to eat. Nothing to complain about. I did give it only 4 stars because there are a couple of other places that serve homemade ranch on the side which makes the pizza taste even extra delicious.

FFmqefxd3QRwQB-GjQu_dw.text: I'm a vegetarian so a lot of times I have to just settle for an Italian-no meat, or a lack-luster veggie only sub... but the Mediterranean at Pizza Perfectta is by far the best sub/hoagie I have ever ordered from a pizza place. Garlicky, not too soggy, great cheese and flavorful toppings- I LOVE IT. I can't speak to any other hoagie because it's the only one I get. 5 stars, everybody.

tp7fMPAuM3MATq8_1Qhqlw.text: I have had some of the best food from here. Pizza, hoagies, wings, and wedgies. Definitely my go to place. This food is on point every time I've ordered and I'll keep ordering from here. When my friends from our if town come to visit I'll give them options but they always go for Pizza Perfectta. 6/5 stars of I could.

f2YNQfMd1Em4dLhnVb86gA.text: Tried this place after we got bored of our usual. Pizza took an hour and fifteen minutes to arrive. The order from the eatstreet app (1 medium pizza, half cheese half pepperoni) was not what we got. We got full pepperoni, and the receipt from Perfectta did not match the receipt from eatstreet, which has never happened to me before. It also meant that the person who didn't want pepperoni had to pick it all off. We would have complained and asked for a plain small to compensate but we didn't have an extra hour to wait.   The pizza was cold (unsurprisingly - I called in and was told the driver had taken over 15 minutes in transit because Polish Hill is apparently not close to Shadyside...? I can walk to Pizza Perfectta in a half hour.) and the flavor was merely okay. Will not order again.

fxD8bFOra2trlN0UJUoyHQ.text: Went last night for a late dinner and loved the hot fresh pizza.the only downside was limited seating at the window. I wished this place had table and chairs outside to enjoy the ambiance and food.

wbiC22q97K29jTHbzNR10g.text: The food and customer service from this restaurant are really top notch.  I am continually impressed with how fast the delivery is and how likeable the drivers are.  The pizzas here are excellent as long as you don't get the "crab meat" topping (I should have expected gross imitation crab meat since we're so far from the coast).  The breadsticks, jalapeno poppers, and wings are also delicious.  Some of the best pizza in Pennsylvania.

yktjtLy59hGL3QORcDOFkw.text: I looooove their pizza! They bake my cheese with ricotta and tomato extra for a crispier crust. I'm a crust girl, and theirs is perfect. I always get a salad too but they continue to disappoint on that end. The lettuce is often brown and never crisp. I hope they get it together soon or else I will just stick to pizza. Fast delivery and good price :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Plain cheese side view.
Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Plain cheese pie

gEptg08SmdnSShcgsMjIqg.text: Large take out pepperoni pizza filled a delicious hole on a really cold night! It was ready in 15 minutes and was exactly what I was looking for in a take out pizza. Chewy crust, zippy sauce, greasy cheese, and tasty meat. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Large pepperoni with banana peppers.
Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dozen fresh hot wings.

XFlON60caO6GBJr53rKyTQ.text: They close at 12am and I put my order at 11:58 and they still deliver it fast to me. Great people!!

dgqhjJteeakjJXoYKml0Ew.text: Super fast delivery and the food is-always tasty.   Great service and would definitely continue to eat here

S9TxibFFQT8ztFQqjKa9pQ.text: I stopped by here today with my fiance for a quick slice of pizza for myself.  I had noticed this pizza place before and had wanted to try it but never really had the chance before today.  Inside it looked like your normal pizzeria with a counter to order from, a pop cooler, a display dessert case and a pinball machine which was sadly not on. The temperature inside was pleasant as the air conditioner was set to 66 which was a good change from the stickiness outside.  We were greeted almost immediately on entering and I ordered a plain slice.  A few minutes later we were on our way with my slice of pizza.  I was happy to feel that the box was actually hot and so the slice was properly warmed.  Upon opening it I was also pleased to see that the slice was pretty large.  The pizza itself ended up being really solid.  On it there was a good covering of good tasting cheese which did not fall off the pizza when eating.  The crust was crispy and of medium thickness which meant the slice wasn't floppy.  Finally my favorite part was the sauce which had some good flavor to it.  As a matter of a fact you could see the spices when looking at it closely.  The bottom line for me is that I would eat here again in the future.  I liked the pizza that I had here and may even order a whole one in the future.

gnp9aRnj4DIwpCBBnCrHcg.text: There aren't many places in Pittsburgh where you can get an above average large cheese pizza for $9. They also have a traditional pizza place menu with salads, hoagies, breadsticks, pastas, and munchies. The cheesesticks are great when you're craving something cheesy and salty, and their grilled chicken salad with fries and ranch dressing is dependable as well.   One great thing about this place is that you can stop in and grab a slice or two if you're in a hurry. This place is right along my way home from the bus from work, so I'm always tempted to stop here.  If you're looking for a great place to grab an inexpensive pizza, check out Pizza Perfectta!

ZL_qdEeyZDcjxSgofqn2Sg.text: On the positive side, the delivery was pretty quick, given I ordered during the dinner rush, where I would consider under an hour to be pretty exceptional. After that, the food was pretty meh. The pizza wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. Given the relative quick delivery, it was on the cold side upon arrival. Also, I had ordered a fried pickle appetizer. It was clearly a frozen appetizer, so I knew what to expect, but this also arrived cold and soggy. All and all not a terribly positive experience given the vast wealth of take-out options in the area.

qPcWO7X_YYtbZAUT8Uc6PA.text: I wanted to give a much more positive review. Since my last review 9 days ago, I have ordered from this establishment again. So as I come to find out, the negative review on the pizza i orderded 9 days ago was NOT the same for.the pizza i just received tonight. it was really good tonight. i had to order extra cheese and sauce to my liking, but it was really good this time. Thank you guys! ;-)

u3C7TGbqnxpEd7bR2TBcnQ.text: Won't deliver to Lawrenceville, even though only 2 miles away. Don't order for delivery unless you live next door

X10M_bwHwenD6Kxcu9Zl7g.text: Friends, if you are going to Pittsburgh and don't stop by Pizza Perfectta, you are missing out on service and food combined that is must have. I have the privilege of knowing the owner and his family well, and I can thoroughly endorse his professionalism and product satisfaction. An exceptional pizza delivery spot you will be grateful to attend. Excellent variety, hearty taste, and pleasurable service. And they have the awards to back it up, winning last years Best Pizza in Pittsburgh Award for 2012 from a reputable area magazine.   In conclusion, GO!

NlkHvrKQhoeQoXq4vr1mwQ.text: Excellent pizza. Not the best I've ever had. But real good. It's my neighborhood go-to for sure.

bktoqJQp1JrzUaCz5jj7tA.text: Best pizza in Shadyside. Always very quick when I do takeout, and their takeout specials make their larges/x-larges an incredibly good deal.

LjRja5BdOwBN6ww_ETHZUQ.text: Delivery was very fast and the driver was extremely kind, however the pizza was lacking. I was looking for good junk pizza but the pepperoni was burnt and it just didn't satisfy

oyqBcCjLSJ7kcRzngOAX-Q.text: Classic neighborhood pizzeria. The option to go with for delivery or pick up. Very good value to price. Been in neighborhood the longest of them all. Good hoagies as well.  If you want to drive or spend more better options in East End...  These guys are your go to delivery/pick up. Tip if you like a heavier pie or cheese get extra cheese...  Otherwise I find it a bit light.

wW_dzwVeYUyWnfKv9qMC7g.text: The pizza here is amazing. The crust is crunchy on the outside, but not too thin so it's also chewy on the inside.  I always go for pepperoni and mushroom or ham and pineapple.   I cannot add much to this review on delivery or other items because I always get pizza for takeout; however, I did try the garden salad and wouldn't recommend it if you want more than iceberg with a couple of cucumber slices.   Bonus tip: show up early for your takeout to play some pinball! They just swapped in a new one - TRON.

TL9RHKi5bYJlh3TIzq57Yw.text: I been going here since the age of Five and its the BEST PIZZA  ever in Shadyside. Great food by far and no need to go to other pizza places if you live in the shadyside area.

oW-aYFnxCTMRiJ8_zCJsiw.text: Ate here over the weekend and loved it. My boyfriend got the perogie pizza and said it was phenomenal. I just got plain cheese with extra cheese, but I think the normal amount of cheese would have been enough for me. Will come back here the next time I'm in Shadyside!

XCmzrZ9NcXxfbyS1IBG9nA.text: This was not the best pizza. We got delivery and it could have been warmer when it arrived. The flavor was ok. Not sure if I would order from them again. There are many other options for getting pizza, but not all of them deliver.

Vgp8K3raKh1pIPBH3pp1lw.text: Great pizza! Great service! Stopped by for a late night quick slice and the guys made a fresh pizza for us super quickly. The staff were very friendly and the prices were very reasonable. Would highly recommend this place for a quick bite. They are very generous with their toppings and the pizza crust/sauce is awesome!

S-Li8h-YvM1AptKVqx1xPQ.text: Don't be fooled by the humble exterior:  their food is delicious!  Better than Pizza Sola.  Its my favorite pie in Shadyside, and their hoagies and gyros are also delicious.

r-PSzXxASVzeYgIr1O6flg.text: This is what I'm talking about! Always consistent. Quick on time. They got slices on deck bigger than your head for under $3! Steak fries are killer. All around good pie shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I mean... it&#39;s exactly what you want.

ROCHESMIQj4zx9zVIAEsLQ.text: So let me just say  That they said anywhere from 35-45 minute wait  My food was here in 28 minutes exactly..  the food was super hot and the taste was on point!  Thank you PIZZA perfecta  Simply perfect!!!

JBftOyI_Jf5kC6FBE9_dHQ.text: The pizza and hoagies here are absolutely ON POINT. Wow!  I ordered a medium pizza with chicken and spinach. My husband a tuscan chicken hoagie.  First, the medium pizza is HUGE. Easily the size of a large at most places. The chicken was good and not rubbery. The spinach actually had FLAVOR. I eat a lot of spinach pizza and it usually is flavorless. This was amazing.  The tuscan chicken hoagie was next level. Super flavorful and delicious.  Best of all, everything arrived HOT! We've ordered way too many pizzas that arrive lukewarm!  We will DEFINITELY be back!

7qvWYiZJ-jrmlnIFKrS8YA.text: Great pizza and fast service; what more can you ask for?   Everything about the pizza is fantastic! They are very generous with toppings, which taste wonderful, and the general cheese-sauce-toppings ratio of the pizza is very even. However, my favorite part of the pizza is the sauce. I believe that a good, flavorful sauce can make even the most basic pizza sing. The sauce that Pizza Perfectta used for their pizza had enough of a kick so that it brought out the cheese and other flavors of my pizza (mushrooms, onions, and sausage).  When I ordered my pizza from them, they were ridiculously fast about getting it ready and it only took 15 minutes for me to wait to get my pizza from them. I'm sure with delivery it might take longer for your food to be ready but if you pick up your pizza from them instead, it's super quick! Pizza Perfectta is definitely my favorite pizza place in Shadyside and I am so lucky to live close by!!

6lHRbEV43MFZOcy-r6zjPA.text: We ordered pizza for delivery from them for the fist time last week, and it was amazing! We got the Ranchero - love it! fast delivery

49WykYz4KfhBSb7ivI1Szw.text: Excellent, pleased the whole family. Pizza has homemade soft yet toasty crust, flavorful sauce (and not too much!). Hot wings coated in tangy buffalo sauce. We ordered delivery, too tired to venture out. They called a few minutes before delivery, very friendly man brought it still hot. Don't do the chains - eat at this local place!

C-JT8FvX-lVXEqKLSixZEA.text: Solid Pizza  One of the best "Pittsburgh" buffalo chicken in the city. That being buff chick with the thick cut potatoes, chicken, and awesome hot sauce

oyuvPOHPUaP1Kj6FyvXCfg.text: I love this spot for munchies! There is time to choose from on the menu. And the gentlemen who work there are some of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. Each time we go in they are always kind and patient and friendly.  Every time we have ordered it's been hot and fresh. And the bonus is they serve great slices of cheesecake!

O9cG3DwhBa2CuDQaXZNFfg.text: 5 stars for a pizza joint? Unheard of from me until now! The shady side special is the only pizza we have ever ordered from here and I'm pretty sure it's the only thing we ever will order because it is just that fantastic! I mean I hate canned black olives and this thing is loaded with them but they aren't overpowering. The combination of all the flavors makes my mouth sing its so happy. Sadly, we live over an hour away so it's a very rare time that we travel to shady side and don't have a sit down meal as opposed to take away pizza. The service here is always very friendly and quick. My husband used to save up to order a shady side special when he was in school. Seriously any meal that he saves up for better be amazing and this is!

TUqwUCB7ermaRZ4hGiuL-A.text: The guy I order from said it'll take 45 minutes to deliver and that about the approximate time it took. However, I had to microwave my "fresh pizza". That was a bit upsetting seeing as the reviews talked so highly of the place. The pizza did taste good, I guess that's all that matters.

_Y2BihnqkLEymeuujRHaBQ.text: Very yummy! I order the large pie from here for delivery. Service is good, pizza tastes good. What more can you say about a pizza joint, it's either the best you've ever had, solid like Pizza Perfectta, or a lot of expectations were missed.

YU6I74ftvwnKLDkE4uGorw.text: Early last week, with an 18 pound ham in tow (the company I work for gives them out each December as 'tokens of esteem'), I wasn't about to bus it home. Kay, my chauffeur, my savior, my girlfriend rescued me from a rainy, strenuous trip from Lawrenceville to Beechview. But...what to do for dinner?  Pizza: The god in the machine of dinnertime difficulties.   I'd been hearing and reading positive anecdotes regarding this satellite of the local Pizza Milano franchise for the past year, so after plugging the name of the business into the GPS, we were on our way to gilded, bohemian Shadyside.   After tearing into the medium-sized pizza we requested, we found that it was very similar to other Pittsburgh pies in that it was rather doughy and held much cheese as well as a citrusy sauce, but where it protruded slightly amongst the throngs was the crust itself.  Imagine an oven-blackened sourdough bread topped with mozzarella, crushed, stewed tomatoes, bacon, and olives. Imagine further, pure baked ecstasy.   Also bought, shared, and gobbled was a nonpareil tuna melt hoagie that was heavy on the herbed (uncanned?) tuna salad and cheese which formed strings when the sandwich was pulled from our mouths following each blissful bite.   To my taste nodules and breadbasket, there are superior pizza parlors to be found in our amazing city, but Pizza Perfectta is admirable enough to manage a spot in the top 20% with little effort.   P.S. The service was generous, genial, and wonderful. Just as we paid our tab, Kay squealed in joy after noticing that PP also sells Otis Spunkmeyer cookies.  Even though we insisted on paying for them, the gent who took our order gladly gave us a few for free to take home.   P.P.S. Seating is limited to stools and a counter that surrounds the storefront's window, making for fun people-watching...on a stormy, wet evening. Hipsters are a tougher bunch than I thought. Yeesh!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. tuna salad hoagie
Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon and black olive pizza
Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. the storefront on a rainy night

1n-6ILWoS9zMtzprw2Vg5A.text: This is wonderful for late night food runs and deliveries! They have great subs, and usually have good combo deals for lunch!

LpqOlkX546kI9Ll2CcILHw.text: Deliver fast and are very courteous. Pizza is meh but the fried pickles are delicious- perfect hangover food.

Zdw_MIMKU7nhfFJ4qCc4Jg.text: We ordered 5 XL pizzas for a party. 3 specialty (steak supreme, chicken & spinach and Mediterranean), 1 pep and 1 plain. They were all really good. Nothing but compliments from all of our guests. We gave a time for when we needed it delivered and they were right on time. I highly recommend this place if you are in the area!

dfKUo53gWK7QGFoTGRClDA.text: I started out trying this pizza at a friend's house when she had it delivered. I loved the pizza both times and wanted to know where it was from. Finally, I went over and had it on my own. So good! I get extra cheese, which is heavenly. I find this pizza to be less greasy than others I have tried around town and it's satisfying. I love the sauce and the crust. It's not too much or too little. Just the right amount. The interior is fairly small and best for take-out. They have a display fridge with a few desserts. I've tried their cannoli and it's my favorite. There's also bottled drinks available for purchase.

snfNB0VB1kKupPMiu-E-JQ.text: I was pretty disappointed with this place. I thought from the good reviews that the pizza would taste okay. I went here around 12am on a Friday so maybe their ingredients weren't as fresh. I ordered a medium veggie pizza with a side of fries. The fries were super soggy and the pizza was pretty flavorless. There are only about 2 seats inside so you pretty much have to take it to go which was fine with me.   The people working there are really nice though which is a plus. Overall, i wouldn't go back.

BhhdCnt29sADJwTu0IJfWw.text: First time ordering delivery from here and it didn't disappoint. Nice crust, fresh toppings, and super fast delivery.

eLMzfmF2bPktKfvB2Z5T6w.text: Tried Pizza Perfectta for the first time today. I had a mini pizza (ricotta, cheddar, and fontina cheese). It was perfect - the size, crust, temperature, and taste. I absolutely loved it.

HdcS7UiWbr1A1XDhRMiqUw.text: OK YUMMY! I just moved here from New York and this is my first pizza experience here...100% Approve. Quick delivery (came hot), made jus how i asked & incredibly flavorful. So happy I found my new spot on the first try.

utXWJSbj7T0cVO4kGNIyPA.text: Delicious. I ordered a small 5-cheese pizza through the yelp delivery. Came within the specified time frame, and was a good temperature (not so hot I couldn't eat it, cheese was set, not too cold). The pizza itself was very nice--not too much sauce and the cheeses all tasted great! Their menu is now on my fridge.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OtMVZhJFXhqZmSP4XKpfjw.text: Fast delivery! Food was still warm when it arrived, which is always a plus when ordering delivery.  I got the special - Large pizza & a dozen wings. I paid the $2.29 extra for a pepperoni topping. Fair amount of cheese & pepperoni on the entire pizza. Crust isn't too crunchy, nor too soft. I got the garlic parm and buffalo sauce ($1 each) for my wings - they put all the wings in garlic parm and gave me a side of buffalo sauce. I'm not sure how that made sense. Also, no ranch or dipping sauce even though it was requested.   Overall, an okay to decent pizza place that delivers. *$1 delivery fee*

qajl2EOh3m3cPpvlQBJKJA.text: Pizza Perfectta bailed my pregnant friend, her husband, and I out a few weeks ago when we were all HANGRY on a Friday night.  Their online ordering system was easy to follow, and we quickly placed an order for a large pepperoni pizza ($12.59 special) for pick-up.  We were quoted a wait time of 15 minutes.  We picked up the pizza at exactly fifteen minutes.  It clearly had been sitting for a bit because it was already cold by the time we got home.  The pizza was just OK.  There was plenty of pepperoni but practically no cheese.  The crust was decent, but it just wasn't a memorable pizza.  The biggest issue here is that there is no close by street parking so it is a big pain to pick up food here.  We probably won't return since parking is such an issue.

qUsDLqOXLGUkOv0-DbsL5Q.text: It was super fast and not a long wait. The people were very friendly and the price was not bad for the size pizza I got as well. For sure tastes very well and will be going to get a second one pretty soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. It took them less than 10 minutes to make and it came out incredibly cute. The pizza flavor it self is delicious!

-Z7LuqY-_ZpZTDjCbiXxCg.text: They claimed on their website that they have "the best wings in town". As a seeker of good wings, let me tell you about my adventure with this place.   Everything started fine with our order of 24 wings with three separate sauces for 3 eaters. The wings arrived exactly an hour later with the exact number of wings promised and a side of celery. Here's the catch...THERE WAS NO SAUCE! My party of three decided to just tough it out and eat the wings plain. They were, I kid you not, so bland that I wasn't sure what I was eating. They literally just threw the wings in the fryer and delivered it to us. So once we realized how unbearable the plain wings were, we called and complained about the sauce. About 40 minutes later, the sauce arrived. At this point, the wings got cold and our hunger turned into an unbearable rage. We tried BBQ, Garlic Parmesan and Spicy. The sauces were just average. The spicy sauce was so weak that I should've just settled with a bottle of sirracha.   The deliver guy gave us a cannoli as an apology....ONE CANNOLI....3 eaters! You get the point. But this gives me the chance to tell you how terrible the cannoli was. The outer shell was soggy and the filling made me gag a little. It looked nice, but didn't taste that great.   So after 1 hour and 40 minutes, 24 wings, 3 sauces and a cannoli... we have 3 very unhappy customers. The wings were the most mediocre wings I have ever tasted. I will NOT order here again for the wings NOR will I recommend it to the fellow wings connoisseurs out there. Final verdict: MOST MEDIOCRE wings in town!

mMh6hmch5q4HM8Uba62s_Q.text: Used to review this pizza as five stars but the recipe seems to be changing. The crust is getting thicker and major inconsistencies with sauce and cheese. No longer would recommend.

9vwSeiIGJq3VvKqTuxTgUQ.text: The quality of pizza is good and the price is reasonable. We ordered pizza from here a few times and we were satisfied in total.

JQ-k50jqJ8CzrzhbPJD44w.text: I just moved to Pittsburgh and this place has already become my go-to delivery place. They are always timely and the food comes hot. Great options for non-meat eaters and very nice delivery staff!

dfzJalrKAHK-s31Dw_6vBQ.text: This is a 5-star neighborhood pizza delivery joint. I've ordered from here multiple times, and the quality was consistent and the delivery was timely and friendly. The food comes hot, and they never forget to give utensils, condiments and napkins.  I've ordered the Wings with Garlic and Parm, which comes in a oven-safe container for leftovers. The Buffalo fries are great as well- and if you top it with cheese you also get the aluminum container. We all know food tastes better when its reheated in the oven.  The Chicken Ranchero Pizza is great, but I feel pretty guilty about eating it, so I just order regular pizza with random toppings that I'm in the mood for. My other favorite item is the Cheesy Breadsticks.  Consistent, delicious quality with reliable delivery=5 stars. I've walked by the store itself- it's a takeout place.

0ZMupvhVWDSsk9x-xG0SPQ.text: amazing pizza in such a short distance from my house!!!! close by is another pizza shop called pizza Parma and I honestly think that these two don't even compare! my friend and I ordered personal pizzas and they were outstanding! the pizza is significantly better than pizza Parma and I will definitely be ordering from here from now on! I know it's just your basic take out pizza and appetizers, but it's some of the best I've had!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. personal pizza with pepperoni and mushroom
Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. personal size pepperoni pizza

8J6WF267QdyA63fpl-c6yA.text: Working weekend shifts at work are kind of annoying, but the perks can be sweet! One being free lunch! This previous weekend my boss bought us lunch from Pizza Perfecta.   After ordering pizza at home twice that week (we DID NOT feel like cooking), I decided to go with a grilled chicken salad. Meh. I'm not saying it was bad, but it wasn't really that great either. I thought they could have dressed it up some more. It was loaded with (too much) cheese and it melted due to the fries being warm, making the top of the salad kind of gross. Underneath the melted cheese was the lettuce, tomatoes, onions and cucumber. I guess this is all standard for a salad, but it really just didn't impress me. Plus, I thought the chicken tasted pre-cooked which should be a big no-no for restaurants. One perk, however, was the size as it was pretty big! However, for $8.00, I felt it was a little steep.   I also had a slice of pizza (I can't resist pizza) and it was comparable to any other pizza shop.   Service is very good, though! I placed the order and the employee I spoke with was very friendly. They had it delivered in time as well.   I'm not complaining because it was a free lunch, but I would never order myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled chicken salad.

aV2WtY2kteHd1ZnQuqWH3g.text: Somewhere in the range of mediocre to decent pizza that delivers.  Would eat again but wouldn't go out of my way for it. In general, if I'm going to spend the kind of calories that pizza takes, I want something better.

f3-Ti4dKdZfWINfI0z6Teg.text: Ordered pizza delivery from them yesterday. Great service since the pizza got here in under 30 minutes. Pizza was still hot, and tasted delicious. I ordered the medium vegetarian pizza, but it was quite big. Could only eat half of it. Looking forward to trying the gyros and other things.

niQEmoUcA-naRRp80l8Zeg.text: Ordered a buff chicken and bacon pizza. Unbelievable. We are in awe. It's a great price, and you honestly can't afford not to order some right now.  Also, you're looking for a great sub, look no further than the steak ranchero. Do yourselves a favor, and call now.

PcdcAvW4dnHGjNs9pmqXkw.text: Tastes pretty cool. Wrapped my pizza in foil after, the slices I couldn't finish. I have to admit, used a lot of foil

qdmxzbxH1CjR1vUzZ64CtA.text: Fast delivery and great pizza. The workers are friendly which makes things even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NtBh6umzmi4jgbGCdcR-vQ.text: I'd been wanting to try pizza from this place for awhile, and I received the opportunity to do so when my dept. had some delivered for an event last Fri.  Overall, I found their pies typical of PGH pizza in style, and slightly above average in quality, hence the 4 star rating (my average rating, as well as the PGH Yelp citywide average, is 3.5).  Jason F. describes the elements of the pizza well, so I won't reiterate them.  I will mention that there was a generous amount of cheese, and the sauce:cheese ratio was on point.  I don't recall the crust being particularly crisp (my personal sticking point when it comes to pizza); however, on the other hand, I don't recall it being floppy or insubstantial, either.  In terms of overall quality, Pizza Perfectta's pies are a cut above those of nearby Pizza Parma, and they offer similar conveniences (acceptance of credit cards; delivery).  Given that I don't order food for delivery, I'll stop by in person the next time I'm in the vicinity of Shadyside/East Liberty.

mvXKkCTS8Uqj2tLlmQRO0Q.text: It's not a complete weekend for me without a stop at Pizza Perfectta. Pittsburgh pizza shops can be hit or miss, but these folks get it right.   The pizza itself is pretty nice. Well done, a good flavorful sauce, and just the right amount of crust. While they have good pizza, I usually find myself sticking to the hoagies, which are some of the best in town. They're loaded well and toasted to perfection. I highly recommend the steak and mushroom, as well as the chicken parm. Very filling, and the whole ones often serve for two meals for me. The wings I've had were good, too. Nice and meaty, and just the right amount of sloppy.   Prices are on par with most Pittsburgh pizza shops, and I'd highly recommend checking out the online coupons on their site. Pizza Perfectta is fast, delicious, and a great value. Easily the best in Shadyside!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Perfectta - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half steak hoagie, half-dozen garlic parm wings, and a pop, all for about $13. All was delicious!

WFUDTYLBQc1zar2WImKs3Q.text: Definitely prefer asking for things extra well done. Roommate and I usually get wings/pepperoni pizza from pizza joints and their wings and pizza were great! Not as much pepperoni as I'd have preferred but definitely plenty cheesy.   The buffalo sauce is another way I usually judge places but I didn't wanna try it. It looked pretty creamy and was a lighter orange than I'm used to. Roommate said it was sorta like 1000 island but ... then again I've never had that either ha.  Little expensive too but they usually have coupons you can use!

kzZk8K45moUb1Qayzkl_bA.text: One of my favorite places to eat! I am always ordering dinner from here. The portions are perfect and great for sharing. I'm always getting a hoagie, an appetizer to share with my roommates, and something to eat for lunch the next day. When I order in, my food ALWAYS arrives hot and delicious. My favorites are anything buffalo and the ranchero chicken hoagie. This is always my go to!

bM47tScMntJOMP5HsAWEGw.text: One of the wedgies ever made. Lots of places have a variety of wedge type items but nothing like this, the outside of the crust is crisp and delicious and the cheese is baked right on the bread. So good and so many varieties. Plus they have really good pizza as well.

FaFS49sD7AuSHCqJ-AnZqQ.text: I keep leaving this review and I feel like it gets erased or taken down. I'm either way this place can't get my business anymore. I recommend Fazios or... Any other pizza place that's not them or Roach-ridden Palermos across the street from them. Best Pizza in the burgh: Sanremos: Market St Mineos: Murry Ave Fioris: across the bridge Vincents: Ardmore Blvd HONORABLE MENTION: Aiellios: Next to Mineos

CWNFT9FW6dHsO9A_OUijcA.text: Decent pizza. You get very good value for what you pay especially if you do a takeout deal. I ordered a large cheese and thought it was better than a chain but still a very average pizza. Again, good bang for your buck with a deal. I'm sure I'll order here again during college football or nfl season!

dTXUacs65PkAadftGxT4MA.text: To be honest, nothing stands out to me about Pizza Perfectta. There are so many pizza spots in the area and this one is just average. I enjoy ordering lunch here because they deliver to where I work. However, so often my order is wrong and small notes about my order are overlooked.

fx5fvvJdKMYTYQLA4XxE4A.text: I live across the street from this restaurant. Pizza, Wings, & Salads are all good. AND EVERYONE HERE SPEAKS PERFECT ENGLISH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  YELP needs to take immediate action and remove the xenophobic/racist review from  Ciara C. Carrick, Pittsburgh, PA  We have no room for this disgusting/small minded behavior in Pittsburgh/Shadyside  Yelp is a platform for food critique not political ideology.

c4LC3jR2ycOlLE9_5R_6dQ.text: If I'm being honest, it was just okay. I was pretty underwhelmed considering the prices. It was definitely ready on time and hot when I picked it up. The hot wings are tasty, but they are different than typical buffalo hot wings. Ordered a shadyside special pizza and it was good but nothing impressive. There are exceptionally better pizza places in Pittsburgh.   Would I order from here again? Probably not, I'd roll the dice on another shadyside pizza joint if I'm in that neighborhood.

SQpGODlYF8hxd6PIvSk1JQ.text: Ordered 3 different calzones and one spaghetti with meatballs.  All were great.  Really liked the sauce.  The only negative is the spinach in the one calzone was doubtfully fresh, as advertised.

BZkivXbb_rH4amkObQMNfQ.text: I try to only order from Yelp once a week, I had a looong day and I was really looking forward to not cooking in the heat. I ordered 6 fresh wings and tiramisu. Not only was the delivery driver almost half an hour late but I was really disappointed with my food. The wings were tiny and the tiramisu came the smallest container and it was frozen! PLUS it was $4.99!! I expected a healthy portion for that price. I will not be ordering from this location again.

nuuxtIIPnrILIbI-7O7Gjw.text: Staff is super friendly. We ordered a white pizza and pepperoni rolls. Pepperoni rolls were delicious, white pizza was good but basically pizza without red sauce lol never had it without those blobs of ricotta cheese but maybe I'm spoiled growing up with NY pizza

h7FVI0YvwJXQEFtBMhCsrg.text: Since I moved to this small town I've noticed the pizza places are are a big thing here. I've had my fair share of good pizza but I must say that pizza perfectta was by far the best in town hands down. I give this joint a perfect 10 keep it up fellas

RdzxxwCgdw_InwURtJDdwA.text: Average, very average in all aspects. Ive heard mixed reviews about the place, and decided to order delivery a couple times. Mini traditional pizza with fries and buffalo fries. Like i said, very middle-of-the-road food, nothing special. Pizza was OK, nothing terrible about it.

L1nscp1ue2YNhrqTCLgNbA.text: Tastiest pizza in Pittsburgh. The extra large takeout offer is really affordable for college students.

0E64PlEKa0mOKAxEJCNffw.text: I order fairly large orders for student events from here frequently. I've never encountered nicer or more helpful employees. They are always happy to take our large orders, even on short notice, and always arrive on time.  Also, their pizza is delicious. I highly recommend Pizza Perfecta!

AIFu2V-j9uCFL7J7LMUXdg.text: I've ordered from here a bunch of times (through Yelp!) and they always seem to be the go-to pizza for a party in Shadyside.  They are always on time and the delivery people are always super friendly.  I really enjoy their sauce and I also order peppers on my pizza - if we're going to be honest, I usually eat the entire pie in a day...by myself.  It also heats up pretty well for the off chance I have leftovers.

AITThSOIWbj4vwgdUt3H5w.text: Excellent pizza- just bought a buffalo chicken pie and was extremely impressed. Would definitely recommend !

Olabgc0vBwilIzUH6Aa6Ow.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my personal 6 inch pizza with mushrooms and breaded wing dings. I got some ranch dressing for the wings and they were very tasty. Not many places bread wings, so I'm glad that this is an option. My order came earlier than expected. I count this as one of my favorite pizza places.

4aslVqPe4ZYmcwiOAF3xIA.text: Extremely poor service from owner. Thought he was a nice person but he actually doesn't trust black people. Nor does he like doing bh business with them.

QNqcrbBGeamgALHmBVzMZg.text: I'm not sure how this place got such good reviews  First off, I called to place my order and could not understand the guy for the life of me on the other end. Not to mention you could tell he was getting frustrated because he kept having to re ask the questions I already told him. Here's a thought, maybe someone that speaks better english should answer the phone? I ordered 12 wings, asked for them crispy because I absolutely hate gummy wings and a mini pizza with mushrooms. The wings were gross, completely gummy, even though I stressed when I ordered to please make sure they were crispy. The pizza was completely mediocre at best, definitely nothing special and definitely not that good either. Lastly, when I called they said delivery would be 30-40 mins... I waited over an hour and 15 mins to receive my food. Definitely will not ever buy from this place again, spend your money somewhere else.

o_U677gqrVymsWTAjNKdGQ.text: Ew. Okay, not the worst pizza ever, but it's pretty far down my list of pizzerias...and that's sad, considering I quite literally live across the street from it. This should be my go-to pizza destination but I'd rather pay a delivery charge than eat their pizza. The sauce is way too sweet (like, Papa Johns sweet) and there isn't enough cheese. There are too many decent pizza delivery places around to settle for this. The only thing I enjoy about Pizza Perfectta is that their sign hilariously claims, "Excitingly flavored!" Personally, I wasn't having an orgasm over my mediocre pizza. Maybe if they wouldn't have tempted me with such language I would be less pissed off at them. Two stars only because they let me borrow some paper cups when I moved into my apartment and hadn't unpacked my kitchen stuff yet. Without them I may have had to travel half a block north and grab some from a different restaurant. Thanks, Pizza Perfectta.  Oh, and here's a little Italian lesson for you: it's "perfetta," not "perfectta."

v1LGxs4ABDLfXpiS_yMRZQ.text: Well since I stop here on my way home from work every Friday I have to give it 5 stars.  Some of my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh.  The cheese blend is really good.  Firm, not too greasy, and the sauce is really well balanced.  But how about the crust?  Really nice texture.  Perfect chewiness.  I would recommend Perfectta to anyone!

nQDKrSsPHcK50rbxsfW0Tw.text: This is my favorite place to order delivery pizza from. they are fast and consistent in quality and the pizza is always great. I've had their cheese steak subs too which were pretty good as well...but the pizza rocks. :)

1uCLieJ85YDnHdYweKFPRA.text: best pizza in pittsburgh imho  try the spinach and feta specialty pizza - reminds you of good pizza in new york

r7ufW9WVuopXKh_W6E-DPw.text: I called for a delivery of a pepperoni pizza, large. Very simple since I was in the mood for it. The delivery and the time taken were exceptional. Very fast, very good delivery service.   The down side is the pizza. It was hot and fresh, but the flavor was just OK. It wasn't the best nor was it the worst. It was just OK.  If you do find that you like your pizza and need a quick delivery, you can't go wrong here. Other than that you may want to look elsewhere.

7RoFX__NKw38CT1vP6rhig.text: We came here for pizza (Darren can't get enough!) a couple of weeks ago, and it was pretty awesome. The guy behind the counter was really nice and gave us free cookies. The tuna melt hoagie was really good also.

g3QYWRLCBVVSDr8LA2AtNg.text: This is hands down the best pizza place in Pittsburgh.  It has a modest exterior, but you can't judge a book by it's cover.  This used to be my regular pizza place when visiting family in Pittsburgh and now I make it a point to go back whenever I'm in town.  Coming from the NY/NJ area which is pizza and Italian food heaven, you can say I'm picky when it comes to my pizza and I often find it difficult to find good pizza outside of the area where I live, but Pizza Perfectta totally delivers with great taste every time.  The sandwiches and side orders I've tried have all been great as well.  Top it all off with reasonable prices and friendly service, and these guys got me as a loyal customer for life whenever I'm in Pittsburgh.

PkRIUVyWJKEqipsAosRpEg.text: Tillies!! If you like Italian food, you should be eating at Tillies! I am reviewing Pittsburgh area restaurants because I live here. If you want good food and great service, go to Tillies! Get the house Italian dressing on your salad, try the zucchini, and any dish that you order that has spaghetti sauce or meat sauce is a WINNER!!! Chicken parm is delicious and so is the Marsala!! Enjoy!!

rqmxUNQWne_jmY-_bsQqjQ.text: Fresh, prepared quickly, and always delicious! Everything tastes like it is from scratch--recommend the hoagies, salads, and specialty pastas. Spinach feta and Mediterranean pizzas have amazing crusts!

IExRN1Pgz9f5tHgHm1ueTg.text: I've never actually been to the restaurant, but despite the plethora of pizza joints in the area (and believe me, we've sampled a LOT), this is the only place from which my Partner In Cuisine and I will order hoagies.  Even when they got our order wrong once, they were quick to fix it and deliver the replacements within a few minutes.  I can honestly say that the many times we have ordered from Pizza Perfectta, we have never actually had the pizza (but I hear it's good).  We just keep gravitating back to those hoagies!

RPqWMFQ4TrZ7S_mv6UHdPg.text: I called for delivery and the lady on the phone was super patient and nice. I asked her for a thin crust vegetarian pizza and she said no problem she got it. The delivery was really fast, within 30 minutes and the pizza was amazing. It wasn't the crappy here's a few bell peppers here or mushroom and tomato there. It was fully loaded with freshly chopped up tomatoes onions mushrooms spinach the works! Very happy with their pizza and their service I would definitely order from them again!

H9iFNln4QEjVXozl-QfaFQ.text: Got the rancho and the Greek, not so bad but I probably won't go back... Too heavy for me...

vZkmqspMueT12Zet2Oxgug.text: DO NOT ORDER THE HOT WINGS!! If you enjoy eating hot sauce flavored gravy paste, then by all means these are the wings for you. If not, stay away. My boyfriend and i each ate one and couldn't even finish the rest of our dinner. Don't waste your money!

ywXXXXcsMu5TApphsMOzVg.text: I love N.Y. style pizza.  Could eat it every day.  On a recent to trip to Pittsburgh I tried alot of pizza and this was good pizza.    One thing about Pitt pizza... it is slightly different than True NYC style:  the crust is not as thin and there's a whole lot more cheese.  As a rule Pitt pizza also has a slightly sweeter tomato sauce.  The sum of its parts is still a delicious close cousin to NYC pizza.  The pizza I tried in Pitt in my order of favorites: Fiori's Pizza Sola (Penn Circle Branch) Pizza Perfectta Aiello's (Murray Street) Beto's  Save for Beto's, I thought they were all delicious.  Wish I had a chance to try Mineo's.  A Pittsburgh native friend of mine calls this his favorite but they were closed July 5th when I went by their place on Murray... I'll try them next time I'm in the 'burgh.  Pizza Perfectta has a few stools and a counter but really it is a take-out place.

U7WubT_K1BZlGlhEEdew6g.text: All around delicious pizza, hoagie, apps place.  Always good. Consistent.  Can vouch for any pizza, Italian hoagie, jalapeno poppers and fried mushrooms. All good.  Do yourself a favor and order perfecta.

FPEnWmNqr9-1zIBkyAYbAg.text: I live right around the corner, so this is my go-to pizza place.  We've ordered both wings and pizza from this place, and I can't complain.  Pizza is delish, the staff are always friendly, and the pizza is always done on time!

Qm9d212jqtMkb26d5RwT3g.text: WOW! The prior 5-star reviews just about say it all. What I was particularly struck by was the delicious gourmet array of pizza and sandwich combinations at an unbeatable price. Delivery is timely and friendly too.

epvVcxPh8GBcrtG9YGI7Ew.text: This Valentines Day I ordered a pizza for my boyfriend and asked that they make a heart on it out of green peppers. The pizza was great, the heart was perfect, and he loved it!

7hbb-21rJlRJzj-1s1davA.text: this is my go-to delivery place -- low minimum for free delivery, they always get my order right, and they always get here quick!  their gourmet pizzas are awesome (mediterranean, greek, and spinach and feta are my favorites).  their regular pepperoni pizza is also the best i've had in pittsburgh.  love their wing zings (breaded spicy wings) and steak and cheese hoagie too.  haven't tried their calzones or pasta yet.    pizza perfectta is sooo much better than pizza sola...pizza sola is so hit or miss.  and much friendlier/more competent people working here.

sHsOyMPwnegRUdI-QIW06Q.text: In all fairness, I went to this place after stuffing myself at Vincent's Pizza Park.  Still, I know a good pizza when I see one, and this place is totally passable, but great or even good it is not.  My friend and I were given our pizza in a box although we were planning on eating on the premises.  Still, it seemed like we were not wanted and decided not to press the point.  We walked across the street to a parking lot and saw a Pizza Perfecttta box and some leftover pizza littered on the ground.  In the end we didn't finish our pizza and assumed that many people in the past have been hastily handed their pizza, pushed out the door, only to walk across the street, eat mediocre pizza, and decide it wasn't even worth the energy to pick it up and throw it away.

jIcYwFvLgpxytn8poy_h5g.text: By far my favorite Pizza place in the east end.  The buffalo chicken pizza here is fantastic, and very unique.  I haven't been able to find anything even remotely approaches it in other cities.    The place is a bit pricey, but I feel its worth it.  My go to pizza delivery place!

EHNRlQlZEABI5B7eE8la_w.text: Great subs, great pizza and quick service for good prices.

2fVZXUBbDDz2Rz0PIOfl8g.text: For $10 you can get an 8 inch sub and a GIANT slice of pizza. Needless to say, this has become my favorite place to order dinner from.

TAV0VfTf8CcD1DEwanPrTw.text: My favorite for Pt. Breeze/Pittsburgh East End. Flat New York style, not greasy, timely delivery, they know my orders!
